Reviews.Content: Will not recommend... We booked the Holiday Package, which includes 5 nights in a Deluxe Pool View Room. We made reservations for a room with a king sized bed, however, upon arriveal, we were told it's not available and we had to take a room with 2 single beds. On the next day, we were moved to a room with a king sized bed, however, due to availability, it did not have a Pool View, instead, the balcony faced the back of some hut. Also, this room did not have a TV remote and the safe was broken. On the 3rd day, we were awakened at 5 am by a terrible stench and had asked the front desk to check it out on our way out. When we returned that evening, the odor was milder but still there, so we asked the front desk if they found the reason for the smell and were told that maintaince had looked at it but he did not say what the problem was and is not in the building at the time. We switched rooms again and were placed in a larger room, still no Pool View, also missing a bedside table. The room was right across from their restaurant, which featured live music that starts in the evening and continues well after midnight, so the noise was terrible. Oh yeah, and the Tropical fruit in the room upon arrival promised on the website was received on the 4th day, not that we would've eaten it anyway since most of the fruits were kind of stale. Overall, not a good experience and will not stay at this hotel again.Pros: -convenient location, friendly staff-Spa was pretty good-beautiful garden and poolCons: -very run-down and dirty (all three rooms that we stayed in had nasty showers)-inefficient staff (have to call room serice at least twice before they show up with our requested item each time)-no free internet service (costs about $10USD for each hour)
Reviews.Author: ChristineinKL

Reviews.Content: Awsome Experience Kuta Paradiso Hotel was an awsome experience for a holiday. Travelling in a group of 10 ladies we stayed at Kuta Paradiso for 8 nights which we found wasnt long enough as we all felt as though we hadnt even touched the service for shopping and day tours and things to do!! Although we were not all lined up together in our rooms we all had magnificent views of the pool (which you can basically swim all the way around) and off the ocean. The pool was just amazing and it even had sports in which you could entertain yourself with like volleyball, basketball and the main attraction the BAR :) The cocktails were really yum and the staff were very friendly. The hotel accomadation price was reasonable and i think it cost us a total of $400 Australian for our entire stay which included breakfast daily. The hotel was also upgraded on security and as you know the bombings are always a scare but it made you feel more secure entering and exiting the hotel with security at the front gate with scanning devices and mirror devises if you ever came in a taxi to the front of the hotel or even in your tour bus. The rooms were really enjoyable and were a very comfortable stay. Most of all the staff made it such an enjoyable stay and were very friendly and helpfull. I would definately go back to this hotel and the other 9 ladies would too. (We are all planning to travel back in two years time)
Reviews.Author: MizzFizz

Reviews.Content: Friendly, efficient staff. Clean and lovely hotel Visited Kuta with my mum this month and we were very impressed by how friendly the people in Bali were. This was the same case for the staff in the Kuta Paradiso. They were very friendly (all spoke English) and the service was very efficient - our toilet was blocked on the last day and was fixed immediately (I was impressed). The pool area is lovely although I think the chairs on the pool side should perhaps be updated (nothing major though). The only downside about this hotel is that it isn't beachfront but we were 'teased' with the sound of the ocean which was obviously very close by.Security is very high in this hotel - bags are checked on entry (which is reassuring considering the history in Kuta). There are shops, bars and restaurants within 5-10 mins of walking from this hotel. All in all we were impressed with this hotel. The only thing I would probably do is to ask for a room with a better view - eg sea or perhaps just one that faces the pool. (Ours faced a fence with plants, but it didn't bother us as we spent minimal time in our room anyway).
Reviews.Author: JeanneTan

Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my time at Paradiso       The view from our room
Reviews.Author: tallulah_belle_8

Reviews.Content: Dodgy financial treatment of guests Dear Tripadvisor readers (WARNING),We have been staying at The Paradiso Hotel a few times before (approximately 1-2 times a year for the last four years). We have always felt that although the hotel is reasonably nice and has an excellent location, there is far too much focus on getting the money out of the guest's pockets. Everything is charged and negotiating anything has turned out to be simply impossible, which gives the hotel a rather greedy image.Worst example was this summer where we had booked a family room for a five day stay with our three children. Due to an emergency we were unable to actually arrive on the scehduled date. The Paradiso management insisted that it was impossible to reimburse or in any otherway compensate for this fact - costing us hundreds of dollars. The hotel's handling of my queries was most unpleasant and very unprofessional. I STRONGLY ADVISE YOU TO AVOID STAYING AT THE PARADISO KUTA HOTEL (thereare so many othernice places in the same neighborhood where the typical Balinese friendly hospitality is practised)
Reviews.Author: kutatraveller

Reviews.Content: very good service it was my first time in bali. kuta paradiso is in the best location. shopping, beach, food, internet cafe (because the business center was closed sunday), etc. everything we needed were just steps away. the employees were friendly, can converse in english and knew answers to our questions. the spa was clean, attendants well trained, massage was excellent. the breakfast was delicious too. price is reasonable, for first visits, i highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: Prue0104

Reviews.Content: Okay But I will not recommend it We stayed at the Kuta Paradiso in June 2008.It was ok but I did not like it.Was a little run down, needs renovations.Was book in to stay for two weeks but check out the first day.The kids club was blocked by a micky mouse statue, we book this hotel because it has a kids club.Did not look like it was in use.Not toys etc.鈥?The Room was ok but had a musty smell and I did not like the location of the hotel.Over all I don鈥檛 think it鈥檚 to bad I just did not like the feel of the Hotel and the location.
Reviews.Author: George046

Reviews.Content: not meant for me this hotel is good for its strategic location! stores all over, surrounding this hotel and when you walk for minutes, you've arrived at some shopping area..but I fund way too many domestic tourists here, it feels like being at Ancol (a beach recreation area in Jakarta) not in Bali..the room is just okay, and the pool is small and crowded with small chidren from local tourists..it makes me feel like im not in bali..and behind the hotel, there is a cemetery.. im not recommending this hotel if you wanna feel bali in a more relaxed atmosphere..
Reviews.Author: fredric_fd

Reviews.Content: Resort-style hotel amongst Kuta shopping       Sunset from balcony
Reviews.Author: Aus2Argie

Reviews.Content: Great Location I have recently returned from a 7 day 'girls' shopping trip in Bali. We stayed at the Kuta Paradiso, this was the 2nd time I have stayed there and we chose it purely for its central location. Its close to Kuta Square  Discovery Mall, so all the shopping you need is at the doorstep. The room was a good size and always clean. The bathroom is also a good size. The hotel staff were always polite. We were upgraded to a Pool View room and it was nice. Breakfast was okay, but as it was the same each day, it became boring after a few days. The only downside to this hotel is that you cant access the beach from it, you need to walk about 5 minutes around the outside to get there and also while the pool area is nice, it gets very limited sun as it sits quite low down and is shaded by the hotel for most of the day, so if you like to laze in the sun all day this hotel is not for you, but if you just want to shop all day like we did, then its in the perfect location.
Reviews.Author: Bellies

Reviews.Content: Kuta Paradiso Not Bad Hotel location is perfect; near water boom, discovery mall, lots of restaurants, mini markets, bars. There are two beach near the hotel: Tuban beach, Kuta beach. But unfortunatelly the hotel not beach front, but pool is great. Lobby and room need to be renovate (old). Breakfast is ok. Overall for me the hotel is acceptable for 3.5 star.
Reviews.Author: leonardth

Reviews.Content: Good but not like we imagine       last day at kutaparadiso
Reviews.Author: hunelle

Reviews.Content: We loved our stay.. Love you Padmini XXXX       Huge Lobby great statues
Reviews.Author: jkgrap

Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Food,Room ammenities and location I stayed at Kuta Paradiso in November and December of 2007. This was my third time and I have already booked for July and November of 2008.The staff are what makes this place tick. All the Department Managers were allways willing to go the extra mile to assure that the stay was enjoyable and the employees in all the departments were excellent.The food was consistently excellent and I never got bored even though I was there for five weeks and ate the majority of my meals in the hotel.I enjoyed the pool, gym, spa, table tennis and billiards and they had a good selection of books.My room was on the fourth floor and I had a great view, the bed was comfortable and the air conditioning was very good. The bathroom was well appointed and there was always a good supply of shampoo etc. The free airport transfer was a great touch. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to fellow travellers.
Reviews.Author: BruceWyder

Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK but got ripped off at check-out The hotel is more like a 2.5 star hotel. It is definitely not 4 star as advertised. I booked my room for 2 nights through RatesToGo but the hotel didn't give me a room with a view as promised with the booking. Parts of hotel was under renovation and hence, not everything was open. The hotel has a open-air concept and hence, it is not air-conditioned except in some restaurants and in your rooms. Hence, it can be hot and stuffy at times.The low rating wasn't so much that the hotel was barely OK but what happened during check-out. Since I booked on the Internet in US dollars, the hotel converted my USD Internet rate to Indonesian Rupiah at a rate of 1 USD to 10000 IDR when the prevailing exchange rate was more 1 USD to 8500 IDR. Hence, with the hotel's exchange rate, they profited about 20% on top of the expected room rate. I complained but they said that was their rate and I didn't have a choice and they wouldn't let you pay in USD cash to avoid the exchange rate either.I checked into Hard Rock Cafe and Westin Hotel next during my Bali stay and both hotels were honest in using the current exchange rate. Hence, I do not recommend Kuta Paradiso or you'll be ripped off during your stay.
Reviews.Author: bluehopper

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel       pool area 2
Reviews.Author: OceansAustralia

Reviews.Content: Just an average one My husband and I checked in for 2 days after spending glorious nights at Kajane Mua in Ubud. The hotel room was clean but a bit worn out, the shower drain a bit blocked so we had our feet soaked everytime we took shower, the bathtub spout leaked too. The rate was cheap but I didn't expect this from a 5 star hotel. It has good location, near the waterboom, night market and discovery mall, also good view of Kuta beach in sea view rooms. Breakfast buffet was fine with lots of choices of menu and differed from other day. I think Kuta Paradiso was just ok but need reparations in the bathroom.
Reviews.Author: j-lho

Reviews.Content: Paradiso Hotel is Paradise! This hotel was booked as part of a package tour through Singapore Air. After booking, I read the reviews on it on this site and others. There were a lot of negative reviews and a few good ones.I was really worried I may have made a terrible mistake!I need not have worried,,,My husband and I loved this hotel! We requested a quiet room on the top floor. Our request was honored. It had a lovely view of the beach and over-looked a temple. We were pleased that we had a balcony with furniture, so we could sit outside and enjoy the warm weather. The room was very clean. We appreciated the hardwood floors. We also liked the large separate shower and bathtub and marble floors in the bathroom. There was always lots of hot water and thick towels. Our beds were very comfortable. There was good light for reading in the evening. The pool was a delight. The landscaping was very well maintained.The lobby and common areas were really gorgeous.The breakfast buffet surprised us with the best French bread and buns we ever had in Asia. The location was central to shops and restaurants.. The lack of access from the beach was the only downside.The staff were very thoughtful, kind, and friendly. We would stay at the Kuta Paradiso, again. Constance  Duane B. C. Canada
Reviews.Author: Condu

Reviews.Content: OK But Better Places to Stay My boyfriend and I stayed at Kuta Paradiso for 6 nights after getting a really good package deal flying with Garuda (Garuda office is at hotel). The room itself was lovely, spacious, excellent bathroom with separate shower and bath. However I agree with other reviewers - this is not a 5 star hotel. After staying in other hotels in previous trips to Bali, the atmosphere at the Kuta Paradiso is non-existent. Seemed as thought we were the only Aussies there amongst alot of large Japanese groups. If wanting to stay at Tuban I have heard alot of great things about Santika Beach and the Green Garden chain of hotels - I personally wouldn't stay at the Paradiso again.
Reviews.Author: Annual_Bali_Visitor

Reviews.Content: Definitely NOT a five-star hotel!!! This is definitely NOT a five-star hotel as mentioned in all their advertising. This is a 3 star at the most - charging 5 star prices.We booked a suite as the pictures on their website and many others of a suite at this hotel has an ocean view and looks fantastic. This was so NOT the case - we arrived really late at night and were led to a dingy room at the side of the hotel overlooking an adjacent bar. There was no view to speak of, there was a huge rat/mouse living in the room and the bar next door had 'live' music until the early hours of the morning. The overall look of the room was run-down and old.We stayed in the room one night and complained the next day. We asked for the suite we had seen online - it was empty so they showed us the room but it took a few hours for them to track down someone who could authorise for us to move. In the end we paid an extra US$12 per night on top of the already exorbitant US$295 per night we were paying.Admittedly the room we moved to was great because the view was as the pictures online suggested - breathtaking. But apart from the view the room itself was looking its age - looks like they haven't maintained the furnishings or decor at all since it was built.Also note that this is not a beachfront hotel.Luckily we had only booked for 3 nights or we would not have stayed after the first night. But found out a few days later that they had charged us twice for the stay - to the cost of some US$900. It took over a week to sort this out and with conversion rate costs as they are - cost us nearly AUD$100 to sort their mistake out. Overall a rather disappointing start to our holiday. Luckily every other place we stayed at in Bali was as expected or even better than expected.It is just annoying that there are some hotels in Bali (like this one) that insist on charging the same price they have always charged - regardless of the fact that their hotels are getting older and are not being maintained. This is definitely one that should be avoided as there are many more lovely hotels that are charging reasonable prices for top-quality surroundings.
Reviews.Author: Avid_Bali_Traveller

Reviews.Content: Unpleasant Holiday Left to Bali (denpasar) on 21/10/2006 from Jakarta. Upon arrival at the airport waited for an hour to pick me and my wife to the hotel ( Kuta Paradiso). Checked in to the room # 254 , the toilet was run down and the bathroom darinage was blocked. After complaning, the duty manager changed the room to # 348.After an hour, I saw a cockroach (about 2 inch in size) crawling from the air condition duct. I complained again. They appolzise in writting.Even the bed and the wall were not impressive.This is not the 5 star hotel as claimed by the travelling agent.Name of Travelling Agengy : SMAILING TOUR.I did not take any pictures.
Reviews.Author: maltbeer

Reviews.Content: What a mistake! My friends and I got 2 rooms and stayed for 1 night. The good : Inexpensive, good location, good breakfast. The bad : The toilets in both of the rooms smelled and looked dirty, the pool is small, rooms were dark and old, worn out beds, noisy at night. Stay here if you don't care much about your room. Don't pay anymore than what you believe a mediocre 3 stars hotel is worth.
Reviews.Author: Tmug

Reviews.Content: Definatly not a 5 star hotel I have just returned from my 12th trip to bali,and stayed at the kuta paradiso, I had read the comments on this site before i went.If you decide to stay here never expect a hot shower (forget the bath) We had 2 days with slightly warm water the water pressure went from decent to drizzle and most of the time it was cold. We had to phone the reception twice (in 4 nights to complain about noise) we dont mind some noise but kids screaming around a pool at 10pm at night wasnt good,other hotels close the pool off at 9pm for that reason . We were upgraded to a delux room when we arrived at no charge (i explained that i was happy to pay extra for a quieter room ). The room was ok ,definatly not a 5 star getting a bit tatty .but very clean and the staff were polite, The hotel is well situated for shopping and resturants,just a fee minutes walk to kuta and the new kartika shopping centre and the security at the hotel was excellent.
Reviews.Author: aaabbbccc

Reviews.Content: Reasonable Hotel The hotel was reasonably ok. Our room was a bit on the small side. The view from our balcony was not the greatest (looked over some old building and the main street). At night, you can hear the music from the clubs along the street. Not great if you are light sleeper.The pool was good. My kids enjoyed it tremendously. Actually add water to any kid and they are generally happy!!! Can't do much wrong there.Breakfast was fabulous. Lots of variety and the food actually changed a bit from morning to morning.Did not enjoy the New Year's event. The entertainment was a bit dull and the event was on the street side which made me a bit nervous with all that has been happening recently, although there was man checking our bag when entering the area. The ticket was a part of our package.No access to the sea though, which was a bit disappointing.All in all, a reasonable hotel.
Reviews.Author: 157Johan

Reviews.Content: lovely hotel This hotel is lovely. We had a beautiful superior room over looking the pool which I would recommend as the standard rooms can be a bit on the small side. The pool was great and the breakfast was fabulous. Great location, near the beach and the centre. Really clean hotel and the staff were super nice. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: AmesC

Reviews.Content: lovely honeymoon I went with my husband in June for our honeymoon.It's a lovely hotel'very good location,very clean,the stuff are so friendly and the food is very good.I do realy recomand it.We did spend a lovely time there.
Reviews.Author: NABILA

Reviews.Content: Perfect What a hotel. Always perfectly clean, food and drink at a very resonible price for a 5 star hotel alot cheaper than any other 5 star in bali. If you want to go out at night or shopping during the day the location could not possibly be any better close to absoloutly everything. Big pool with a basketball ring to have a bit of fun and a swim up bar.Another major bonus i found was all staff including the cleaners all spoke english realy well. The friendliest staff i have experienced in a hotel I would recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to travel to kuta
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: So-So experience I recently returned from my Bali vacation where I stayed in the Kuta Paradiso. I have to say that I wasn't impressed. Our room was generally shabby with a view looking into dilapidated housing about 5 meters away. The shower and bath were ok, though water temperature was erratic (eg hot water when only the cold faucet was turned on.) The gym is an extra fee, contains limited equipment and limited airconditioning. The pool area was fine, but not nearly as nice as the photos. Positive points include friendly staff, amazing morning breakfast, and convenient location. Despite this, I probably wouldn't stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A holiday to remember!!! I went to Bali for my first time last year with my boyfriend. I didn't really know what to expect when I first arrived but am now totally in love with the place!!! Our stay at Kuta Paradiso was one I will never forget! The staff were very friendly and genuinely happy to be there which really showed. The hotel itself was beautifully maintained and rooms were very comfortable. It is a credit to the groundsmen who keep the gardens so well kept aswell. At night thought it is when the place really comes alive with the beautiful lighting around the pool and the big 'tempation island' like fire columns. Sitting by the pool at that time is just heavenly and you honestly wouldn't want to be anywhere else but there. We were really happy with our stay at this most beautiful hotel and can't wait to spend another 2 weeks there this october.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
